comment: Professor Amin takes a week to respond to emails. He's not a tough grader, but he is strict on the similarity score on Turnitin. He has a mandatory group project where you cannot work alone. The project is a 3-page, single-spaced paper. He does not have a clear rubric for this paper. I would not take him again if I could avoid it.

Class was fairly simple. Weekly quizzes no lockdown browser. Test were based on quizzes. 3 hw assignments in total. A lot of PowerPoints and reading materials provided. Study well if you want to pass this class. Highly recommend.
Dr. Amin is one of the best professors that I have had so far at KSU. He is very nice, always available to help. He really cares about his students. I like him and the way he is teaching.

The professor does not teach. He posts labs that have confusing instructions (often outdated) with links to videos that often contain instructions contrary to his own. There are no sessions in which he reviews the assignments. He asks if there are any questions. If you are not savvy with the material before class, you won't be after it.

There never seemed to be a set plan and he would post assignments that would contradict themselves. On the rubric on how our final paper would be graded it stated to use MLA or APA but when we had to write the paper he said to use IEEE. Directions were never clear on assignments and class lectures never had much structure.
Dr. Pouriyeh is one of the best teachers I ever had :-)
